experiment_info.name: improved_triangulation_init
experiment_info.description: Test alternative triangulation formulas from acoustic source localization literature
experiment_info.hypothesis: Alternative triangulation approaches might improve initialization quality

reason_aborted: INITIALIZATION FAMILY EXHAUSTED. Multiple prior experiments conclusively show the baseline triangulation + hotspot init is already optimal. Physics-informed init, boundary-aware init, more inits, moment-based, and multistart all FAILED.

physics_informed_init.finding: Temperature gradients at sensors don't accurately point to source locations
physics_informed_init.conclusion: The initialization family should be marked as EXHAUSTED

boundary_aware_initialization.result: ABORTED - 24% of samples have boundary sources

more_inits_select_best.result: FAILED - More inits do NOT improve results
more_inits_select_best.conclusion: The baseline 2-init strategy (triangulation + hotspot) is already optimal

moment_based_inversion.finding: The triangulation initialization already exploits sensor readings to estimate initial source positions

multistart_elite_selection.result: FAILED - Elite selection doesn't work, single-start is optimal
multistart_elite_selection.conclusion: Single-start with good initialization is optimal

key_insight: The current triangulation implementation uses physics-correct diffusion distance estimation (r ~ sqrt(4*kappa*t)) and trilateration. Acoustic localization formulas are for wave propagation (r = v*t), which is WRONG for diffusion. The current approach is already physics-optimal.
